top_comments.comment: I had recently ordered 2kg of Idukki's green cardamom (8mm quality) over whatsapp from a local reseller there @ 1500 INR (which is 20 USD) per kg. These sellers or agents from Idukki and Kochi are all over the facebook groups if youre looking for cardamom. Also, it's true that cardamom's colour has a lot do with how easily it can be sold to retailers, so it fetches good value. For this, you can sometimes have the sellers / farmers add artificial colour for your batch, which is a common practice not unheard of.
If anyone gets a chance, please visit idukki district of Kerala. The smell of freshly harvested Cardamom is heavenly.

Wearing masks lol.

i live with someone from Pakistan and they love cardamom, usually a bag of it here costs around 1,5-2 euros thats 100g bag making cardamom worth around 15-20 euros in Ireland, i just inspected the bag (as we obviously have one at home) and to me it looks like small to medium sized generally the ''low quality cardamom'' though after i asked Pakistani person i live with if this is a bad quality cardamom, he just said ''there is nothing wrong with this cardamom its as good as something you would get in Pakistan'' now i personally cannot grade it as i absolutely despite cardamom (its disgusting for me), but that Pakistani person has been using the spice throughout his whole life and if he says that 15 euro per kilo cardamom is good, i believe him, the brand he is using is called ''east end'' (a google reference for ye)

I had recently ordered 2kg of Idukki's green cardamom (8mm quality) over whatsapp from a local reseller there @ 1500 INR (which is 20 USD) per kg. These sellers or agents from Idukki and Kochi are all over the facebook groups if youre looking for cardamom. Also, it's true that cardamom's colour has a lot do with how easily it can be sold to retailers, so it fetches good value. For this, you can sometimes have the sellers / farmers add artificial colour for your batch, which is a common practice not unheard of.
Seems it is grown as a secondary crop amongst a primary one. Hopefully this practice cuts losses when conditions are less than ideal.
The small cardamom that sells the lowest grade $12 par kg in India sells for 35$ to 50$ in Pakistan.  You can estimate 90$ par kg. In my country Pakistan small cardamom is really so expensive.
